title: Operations Program Manager - Accessories
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries.
description:
-  Lead Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) Operations team in planning and driving development builds and new product ramps
-  Drive ramp readiness with Engineering, Operations and OEM teams 
-  Plan Capacity and lead factory Capital Equipment budgeting
-  Handle module readiness to ensure part availability, quality and cost 
-  Communicate requirements and schedules to facilitate technical readiness with supply chain teams
-  Influence product manufacturability, testability, and supply chain responsiveness in pursuit of low cost and flexibility while stewarding quality
-  Lead all communications, upward and downward through the organization
-  Raising key issues and options for resolution with executive teams
-  Lead program readiness reviews that include overall program status of design/technical development and operations. Drive closure on design/technical and operations issues
-  Lead operations development builds on-site at suppliers. Responsible for successful mass production ramp up
-  Excellent communicator, able to present in weekly meetings with large multi-functional teams and executives
key_qualifications:
3+ years of experience in high volume manufacturing, process engineering, or product development
Proactive, Results oriented, and high attention to detail while running several work streams
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to present complicated information in simple terms across organization
Use data driven decisions and be willing to take action
Technical expertise and prior OEM management experience
Ability to travel up to 20%
education_experience: Bachelors/Masters in Engineering, MBA is considered a plus
